column1: Happy Thanksgiving. Today I’m thinking about the more than 250000 Americans we’ve lost to COVID-19 and of all the families who are missing a loved one this holiday.   Today we rest. Tomorrow the fight continues.

People in prisons and jails face an extremely high risk of contracting COVID-19 endangering the entire community.  Incarcerated or otherwise no one should be forced into such close proximity during a pandemic. We need compassionate release. https://t.co/1pJMH0aoYC
The COVID-19 case and death rate among those in prisons and jails is unacceptable. We cannot continue to allow vulnerable incarcerated people to suffer. They must be released. https://t.co/gjjh3ynMZ1
COVID tests from @NYCHealthSystem sites are free easy and have the fastest turnaround time for test results in NYC.  Find a testing site near you: https://t.co/HC8EFKFVdC
The number of COVID-19 cases is rising in NYC. Wear a mask. https://t.co/6leWDHFBlh

As small businesses workers and state and local governments struggle to stay afloat Mnuchin is claiming that programs for emergency COVID-19 economic support are no longer needed.  This pandemic is still a threat to our economy. This is cruel. https://t.co/Z6I807v9NY
COVID-19's impact on communities of color has been devastating highlighting the racial disparities that have created systemic failures. They must be addressed. https://t.co/lC7SQlV2k1
COVID-19 is out of hand. @realDonaldTrump is doing nothing to stop it from spreading. https://t.co/pb2XGr6Bid

Donald Trump has done nothing to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 and now as our entire country waits for a vaccine he is turning a blind eye to New York.  Trump has no interest in serving all of his citizens equally and protecting public health. https://t.co/enLSsitYnX
As NYC stares a second wave of COVID-19 in the face healthcare workers deserve to know that they'll be protected with proper PPE and adequate testing. https://t.co/9CEj1PdEBY

NO ONE is immune to COVID-19. As cases rise among young children and teenagers we cannot afford to get lazy. We must continue to be diligent about keeping our families and communities safe. https://t.co/MmCkAPetbv

There is no evidence yet to suggest that people who have contracted COVID-19 are now immune to reinfection or cannot spread it to anyone else. This is a dangerous statement to make.  https://t.co/ub6Zr2uTTq
All across New York COVID cases are rising. Brooklyn -- here's what you should know: https://t.co/Ab4BzOqgOP
🚨🚨 ICYMI: 23 schools that were in COVID red zones will be able to open TODAY. Learn more: https://t.co/LPjY0dFNBn
COVID cases are surging across the country and right here in NYC. But @JoeBiden has a plan to get this virus under control. https://t.co/G4ZGVFuOHT
New York: The pandemic is not over. Wear a mask social distance and get tested. https://t.co/rVLBb42Kqt

We know that low-income NYers have been disproportionately harmed by COVID-19. As it progresses into winter we need to prioritize those most harmed & ensure they receive adequate care. Income should not determine whether a person is worthy of treatment. https://t.co/ub2YDvG73B
Prisons and jails are a threat to public health. They should not be incubators for COVID-19. All at-risk detainees must be released. https://t.co/K2FYnqnsFH
Thousands of Americans are getting sick every day. COVID-19 deaths are not "almost nothing." The Trump administration is lying. https://t.co/jltHiinzKX
Democrats have been demanding COVID relief for months. Republicans have refused to help Americans in need.  https://t.co/4rQlnldZgz
Confused about how and where to get a COVID-19 test and what kind? Use this helpful guide to testing options in NYC: https://t.co/PPT01UIkwe

Instead of passing much-needed COVID-19 relief Republicans prioritized appointing a judge with view widely out of step with the vast majority of the American people.  This process was shameful. https://t.co/MIulKgFEjY
The Trump campaign is spreading COVID-19 -- and they don't care who they harm. https://t.co/E0DW7mf0fo

Today I voted for decency honesty and truth and for the more than 3k Puerto Ricans who lost their lives to Maria the 227k Americans lost to COVID-19 the 545 children separated from their parents and for everyone harmed by the Trump administration’s corruption and lies. https://t.co/DIwyIalaZz

The facts speak for themselves. Donald Trump said Mexicans were rapists. He said that there were good people on both sides in Charlottesville. He insists on calling COVID the China Virus.   @realDonaldTrump is a racist. https://t.co/9kEIqAcDA7

Latinos are going to the polls keeping health care in mind and their experience with Covid in mind and voting for change for their health and well-being.  Donald Trump has no plan for healthcare. Voters know that. https://t.co/JPGFmE9sFU
COVID isn't over. Please continue to take precautions: physically distance wear a mask and limit gatherings. This is serious. https://t.co/m0SSosI7PX

With more than 220000 people dead from COVID and millions unemployed the Senate should be focused on passing a relief package that supports suffering Americans -- not rush through a nominee who threatens to take away our healthcare. https://t.co/vxMySjVCLw
Vote like your life depends on it because it does #HurricaneMaria & #COVID19 https://t.co/n0f7Sf7L9N
COVID-19 spread like wildfire through jails and prisons and the risk is not gone. All inmates deserve ethical treatment period. https://t.co/bwvcv4zqxV

The Trump administration has been careless about the pandemic since the beginning. Time after time they put politics over science and over the well-being of Americans. Their handling of the White House COVID outbreak is a clear example of what NOT to do. https://t.co/SGuUFLspfc
The United States really has done remarkably badly.  The Trump administration's refusal to create a national coronavirus plan is deadly. It's time to vote them out. https://t.co/wzZTabouNJ
The Trump administration has been attacking immigrants and DACA since day one. COVID-19 has nothing to do with their xenophobic policies.  https://t.co/6YRBeld2DN
For months Democrats have been demanding a robust national coronavirus plan. Republicans have refused to work with us. We cannot continue to ignore this virus. https://t.co/NXaPsReNnv
COVID-19 is not over in NYC or anywhere. Please continue to take precautions and protect yourself and your community. https://t.co/PATGFxZvDE
There were more than 44000 new cases of coronavirus yesterday. Cases are not disappearing. The president is lying. https://t.co/KZlT96srku
For many Donald Trump's lack of concern for those suffering with COVID-19 is life threatening. He doesn't care. https://t.co/CYsmVx70Xp

Latinos are less than 19 percent of the US population but nearly one-third of all coronavirus deaths nationwide. Donald Trump's failure to manage the COVID-19 pandemic is directly harming already underserved communities. https://t.co/f9XEQL67Yp

Millions of Americans are desperate for unemployment benefits food assistance rent relief small business aid COVID testing and education funding. Trump is refusing to help the American people at a time of unprecedented need. https://t.co/CnT5eZae7k
Dr. Fauci is right. The president is ignoring the facts. COVID-19 is not “far less lethal” than the common flu. https://t.co/azkYZAC8AR
COVID-19 is hitting marginalized communities harder than most. We have to act to help the most vulnerable among us. https://t.co/uQv7SzCwSm

Republicans and the White House blocked critical aid and deliberately put educators and students at greater risk of contracting COVID-19. Public health is not up for political gain. https://t.co/iRKwfXqWyn
COVID-19 is affecting children in more ways than one. https://t.co/9640Adf1dB
COVID-19 has not disappeared from New York! Continue to take precautions to keep yourself and our community healthy. https://t.co/bUtxsLzvBa
7 million Americans have been infected with COVID-19. More than 200000 are dead. Donald Trump did nothing. https://t.co/u9TKkgAKdn

“I wonder if the authorities are really doing everything they can to protect us.”  Our leaders should be fighting to protect everyone from COVID-19 -- especially those who have historically been placed at a disadvantage. https://t.co/o5kk1cLO2I

For months Donald Trump has downplayed the dangers of COVID-19 ignored scientists and experts and played politics with our public health. This administration's failures are deadly. https://t.co/Ri20wMNYCz
We've lost more than 200000 Americans to COVID-19 a preventable tragic milestone allowed by the Trump administration's inaction. They have failed all of us.  https://t.co/paA2R2QyBq
Looking for a quick COVID-19 result? Visit one of NYC's new rapid testing clinics for easy accessible testing.  https://t.co/0Rqcn62krp

The experts at the CDC should be the ones writing health guidelines not the White House. Yet another example of the Trump administration unwillingness to deal with the coronavirus and keep Americans safe. https://t.co/pXxxGNhIYV

Donald Trump knew how easily airborne COVID-19 was yet continued to hold crowded indoor rallies endangering every one of his supporters. He doesn't care who gets sick. He's letting Americans die. https://t.co/c0tJQjb6UE
Young people are not immune to COVID-19! Please for yourself and your community -- wear a mask. https://t.co/bcFsruJFpy
Young people are not immune to COVID-19.   Wear a mask and keep your distance. https://t.co/c3vUjyyOVF
While New York's COVID rate steadily decreases inmates continue to live in dangerous unsanitary conditions. We must immediately release the most vulnerable. https://t.co/pMY4Ob4FVj
Immigration detention centers have been a hotspot for COVID-19 -- increasing ICE raids during a pandemic is particularly dangerous. https://t.co/ypVvbSyHKP

How can we keep our teachers students and communities safe if they're not given the masks they need?   The next COVID relief bill must be provided with protective gear to ensure the health and safety of their students and faculty. https://t.co/O4txDRssAE
Children are not immune to COVID-19. Trump is risking the health of the children their families and their communities. https://t.co/lyGyGOJNwL

6 million people in America have been infected with COVID-19. 180000 have died. The Trump administration still refuses to expand testing provide PPE or develop a national contact tracing strategy.  We deserve better. https://t.co/r8RZQBKu83
Saying "China virus" is racist.  Viruses have no nationality. Xenophobia will never be tolerated. https://t.co/wvVp8dLXTF
COVID-19 is hitting communities of color hard especially pregnant Latinas.   Donald Trump has routinely ignored communities of color -- and now they're paying the price. https://t.co/IKCgrDrZru

Immigrant communities have been overwhelmed by COVID-19. It's time to support our neighbors and secure the resources hard-hit communities need to weather this crisis -- together. https://t.co/qRTCb1lC6z
Black women are facing two pandemics: COVID-19 and systemic racism.   Our nation cannot recover until we directly address the inequalities that got us here. https://t.co/Mi0HNgwRtC
We're losing one American to COVID-19 every 80 seconds.  According to Donald Trump “It is what it is.” https://t.co/XCZcqatS9T
The United States has more recorded deaths from the coronavirus than any other country.  @realDonaldTrump is lying. https://t.co/t0C4LpMYnn

Too many cases of coronavirus have been tied to meatpacking plants -- an industry that is almost half Hispanic.  We cannot sit back and watch as these communities face dangerous working conditions. https://t.co/GuxEjHh1X1
New Yorkers: TODAY is the last day to apply for rent assistance under the COVID Rent Relief Program! https://t.co/7PeWxt2U1v

Instead of working to get the pandemic under control Donald Trump is bragging about gathering “thousands and thousands” of people in coronavirus hotspots. This isn't something to brag about @realDonaldTrump -- Americans are suffering. https://t.co/BB6B8Th5f0

Prisons should not be incubators for COVID-19. All at-risk detainees must be released.  Thank you to Patricia Kim for bravely speaking out about the failure to contain COVID-19 on Rikers. https://t.co/M2AqXJN6hc

Small businesses in Queens have been working incredibly hard to provide for their community during COVID-19 -- but they're still struggling. I'm fighting to keep these small businesses front and center in our recovery. https://t.co/poZtIdNqVw
Racism has economic impacts and Asian Americans are feeling the impact of COVID disproportionately because of bias.  We need to stand up to hate in every form https://t.co/C2U46Yq6s0

Wang Wang isn't the only one going a little stir crazy during COVID.   Remember: Beaches pools and parks are open. Follow social distancing guidelines and WEAR A MASK -- but there are plenty of safe alternatives to making a hamster wheel for yourself out of your bathtub. https://t.co/si0YMiuZph
Young people: You are not immune to COVID-19! Wear a mask social distance and take care of your community. https://t.co/cGySD3hJJs
It took just 15 days for the US to get from 3 million to 4 million confirmed cases of COVID-19. And Donald Trump still doesn't have a national plan to test and trace COVID-19. https://t.co/LQsfTcfRpD
Millions of jobs have been lost to the COVID-19 crisis.  Black Americans have seen the worst of it: https://t.co/SZOOZerV7K
COVID-19 has already left its mark on our healthcare system. It's time we learn from it and demand better.  A majority of Americans agree -- we need Medicare for All. https://t.co/3EKuJ6Si9L

The Trump Administration sees the pandemic as a PR problem not a public health crisis.   This is alarming. Americans should know that critical coronavirus data is free from political interference. https://t.co/yXlow1Vl5D
Donald Trump is yet again trying to distract from his failed response to COVID-19 that has disrupted Latino communities across America.  We have not forgotten. https://t.co/RRY5V5EuIF

Amid the coronavirus janitors have become highly demanded essential workers.   It's time we understood the value of those risking their health to keep our spaces clean and disinfected. It's time to protect ALL workers. https://t.co/WXYmbDICti

NY's COVID Rent Relief Program is now accepting applications. Eligible households can apply for up to 4 months in rental assistance & will receive a one-time rental subsidy that does not need to be repaid.  Learn if your household is eligible & apply here: https://t.co/0HcBnMBwze
This summer people of color are being hit with a one-two punch of heat and coronavirus.  Congress must do more to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/B0ksREOyRT

The COVID Rent Relief Program will deliver critical rent assistance to NYers but is just a small part of the overall need.   I will continue to fight for additional federal funding to ensure that no one is forced from their home during this crisis. https://t.co/c8PEerSl1q

The White House purposely ignored a CDC report that concluded "fully opening schools & universities remained the highest risk for the spread of coronavirus."   This is not leadership -- this is wildly dangerous. https://t.co/MiEQJN7MJT

No one should ever go hungry especially during a national health crisis like #COVID19. #NYC has a number of food options to assist you or a loved one during this difficult time. Find a free meal location near you: https://t.co/DltPVpOCe9

Transit workers who have been infected with COVID-19 at extremely high rates are also facing aggression by people unwilling to wear a mask.  No one should feel threatened at work whether by a deadly virus or those they work with. https://t.co/C0MywLL3Ie

The Trump Administration has spent the last 4 months using the COVID-19 crisis as an excuse to bring about a xenophobic crackdown on legal US immigration.  Immigrants make this country great -- I won't ever stop fighting for them. https://t.co/3YeXIk3m5r

The US has now passed 3 million confirmed COVID-19 cases.   The House passed the Heroes Act over 50 days ago and the Senate has yet to act -- blocking Americans from receiving the help they deserve and letting the crisis worsen. https://t.co/UIIyoQj5fD
There is no way to safely detain people during COVID-19. ICE must release them. https://t.co/Kceo9bK77i

The Covid-19 public health and economic crisis is hitting us hard and it’s affecting every single person -- Black Americans more so than anyone else.  More must be done to tackle long-standing racial disparities made evident by this crisis. https://t.co/5Ge2MV4jog

The Trump Administration fueled the COVID-19 spread among vulnerable asylum seekers and is now refusing to protect them.  This administration's only immigration priority seems to be to impose its xenophobia and implement hateful policies.  https://t.co/x8CDL1h8ta
No matter how much the President wishes the coronavirus will not just "disappear."  There is a deadly virus killing Americans -- and Donald Trump doesn't seem to care. https://t.co/ijpWMJu3DC
Inequalities in health systems have been magnified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Survival shouldn't depend on which hospital you end up in. We need equal access to healthcare. https://t.co/P2SwAhRzn2

People in jails and prisons are particularly susceptible to COVID-19 yet prisons and jails continue to be largely ignored in our nation's response to the pandemic.  We need to do more. https://t.co/fw6OmsL18u

Puerto Ricans in the US live in counties with the highest possibility of COVID-19 infection and death especially in NYC.  These losses are devastating -- we must do more to protect the most vulnerable communities. https://t.co/WBPji7hDt3
Coronavirus isn't over. We're still breaking single-day records of newly diagnosed cases. Please protect yourself. https://t.co/7HVVrOzhnY

The coronavirus pandemic isn't over -- no matter how many times @realDonaldTrump says it is.  This is literally life or death. We have to listen to data and public health experts. https://t.co/3XH6o8WFiE
Half of NYC’s immigrants are unemployed because of the coronavirus pandemic.  We have failed our immigrant communities. Recovery efforts MUST include these vulnerable groups. https://t.co/t6idZVcApN?

The number of working black business owners fell 41% from February to April. As we work to recover from the coronavirus pandemic I'm fighting to ensure that those who were hit hardest have the support they deserve. https://t.co/k7AKoaAHxa

Over 200000 #DACA recipients and 130000 #TPS holders are essential workers fighting COVID-19 on the frontlines. Mitch McConnell can no longer ignore the #DreamandPromiseAct -- the Senate must pass it immediately. https://t.co/4uBZiY8OIf

At least 64000 incarcerated people have been infected with COVID-19.   The conditions at jails violate the constitutional rights of those inside. It's time to release the most vulnerable. https://t.co/6PP7p28iA6
All New Yorkers can get a free COVID-19 test. Visit https://t.co/oqByPnOEK9 to find a testing site near you and get tested today.

Join myself @Samynemir and @JuliaCarmel__ at a virtual town hall tomorrow Saturday June 13! We'll discuss important updates on the 2020 census and my role in advocating for a just recovery for all from the coronavirus pandemic. RSVP here: https://t.co/XBsfqQFdf0

Packed warehouses endanger not only Amazon’s workforce but those who live with that workforce and the broader community.  I will be demanding greater COVID-19 safety measures at Amazon warehouses. https://t.co/iM63gEgM8g

I've asked FEMA for details about their preparations to respond to the new hurricane season in Puerto Rico amid the coronavirus pandemic.  As PR recovers from COVID hurricanes and earthquakes it needs funds immediately. https://t.co/M1hO0Te6GO
The CARES Act promised federal funding for Puerto Rico which it has yet to receive. As PR recovers from COVID hurricanes and earthquakes it needs these funds immediately. https://t.co/6sfufVUe41
Undocumented immigrants in New York are seeing much higher death rates from COVID-19. Their families should not be afraid to ask for information and burial services. https://t.co/9cpxhvrKcg

COVID-19 has worsened food insecurity in Puerto Rico. It's shameful that Puerto Ricans are receiving disparate treatment through a program that fails to help them when they need it most. https://t.co/GlNjokDhE8

Last night a 35-year-old man Jamel Floyd died at #MDCBrooklyn after being pepper-sprayed and forcibly removed from his cell.  Whether it is a loss of heat in winter inadequate protections against COVID-19 or this most recent incident change at #MDCBrooklyn is long overdue.

I'm fully committed to addressing the racism that has devastated the Black community for far too long. I've worked to open COVID testing sites and set aside loans for lenders in neighborhoods of color and I'll continue fighting to make these communities a priority moving forward
We live in a system that has made COVID-19 far worse for Black communities. We cannot ignore the deep disparities in our healthcare system that has brought us here. https://t.co/mshBMPTRxV
In addition to the coronavirus Puerto Rico is facing hunger and a looming economic disaster.  Congress must work to ensure that Puerto Rico has the relief it deserves. https://t.co/ZRPP0sjG23
Natural disasters don't stop because of a pandemic.  We need to know that FEMA will respond to hurricanes amid the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/vCC5z7RQRt
Our incarcerated populations are contracting the coronavirus at alarming rates. AG Barr promised to take action -- he must immediately do so. https://t.co/komAc6M831

The economic crisis brought on by #COVID19 has proven much more than anyone could have anticipated.   We must give borrowers more than eight weeks to use the funds in order to qualify for loan forgiveness. https://t.co/ukBwsMpiyo
The New Yorkers living in housing co-ops deserve to know whether or not they're included in COVID-19 relief programs. https://t.co/RRcaIBrcV2

Over 100000 Americans have died from #COVID19 -- a milestone Doland Trump once said the country would never see.  We need to act -- it's time for the Senate to pass the #HeroesAct and for the White House to show real leadership. https://t.co/HbXYuWa5tZ
Tens of thousands of NYers live in housing co-ops. They deserve to be included in COVID-19 relief programs. https://t.co/JuImu4KLLy

Communities of color are being hit disproportionately harder by the coronavirus than anyone else.  New York must do more for our communities of color and address the structural inequalities that contribute to these disparities. https://t.co/cETbCYYszG
Immigrant detention centers are not a safe place to social distance. ICE must immediately release those in its custody. https://t.co/a4DrCeCS6O

ICE is using the threat of #COVID19 to force parents into choosing between giving up their children or subjecting them to indefinite detention.  No one should ever be forced to make such a decision. The federal government must end these cruel practices.  https://t.co/sH6JM3BcxR

Nursing homes with high black and Latino populations are twice as likely to be hit with coronavirus than predominantly white facilities. The federal government must address these disparities and protect the most vulnerable from this pandemic. https://t.co/4d01hGuFKH
Yet again the Trump Administration is using the coronavirus pandemic to carry out its cruel anti-immigration agenda.  All people especially children deserve to feel safe. https://t.co/Lj5BuGYnxD
COVID-19 is our biggest threat -- it should be our focus.  I'm proud to join my colleagues to demand no increases in defense spending this year. https://t.co/XSJaHiTkc5

The Trump Administration is deporting detainees from the global epicenter of the pandemic to other countries and sending COVID-19 back with them. We need to free ICE detainees not continue to spread this dangerous virus. https://t.co/Ejm1WSGR5V?

Local hospitals are overwhelmed with COVID-19 cases. With targeted grants I’m pleased to see these funds provide our doctors nurses and other healthcare professionals with the tools they need. https://t.co/SEFjVUBB2h

Many low-income neighborhoods have been disproportionately affected by the #COVID19 crisis. We've now opened testing centers at churches in communities hit hardest by this virus. We need New Yorkers to get tested. https://t.co/xAaDxI2LWQ
Today's students are tomorrow's workers and we need to prioritize them as such. I'm calling for greater emergency funding for higher education institutions in Congress’ next COVID-19 package.

NY will open temporary COVID testing sites at churches in predominantly low-income communities of color who have been disproportionately impacted by this crisis. This partnership is essential to combatting this virus and ensuring our communities' survival. https://t.co/mq39geYdEA
We can't afford to leave anyone out of our coronavirus response. It's time for the state to step up and protect undocumented immigrants. https://t.co/4ZSTsPUriz
Health care access is necessary to combat COVID-19.   We must expand access to care to vulnerable families across the United States. https://t.co/5Nm8oL5bmM

People of color are more likely to be laid off less likely to be insured and are dying of COVID-19 at higher rates than their white counterparts. Further relief must address these racial disparities. https://t.co/OBW2oIwYQo

It's like a slap in the face.  In the midst of a pandemic the Trump Administration is denying green cards to doctors treating coronavirus patients on the frontline. This is heartbreaking. https://t.co/NRljAZICZ7
A 57-year-old man is the first person in U.S. immigration custody to die of COVID-19.  This was avoidable. ICE must release all vulnerable detainees immediately. https://t.co/a2BC3vMpj0

Hundreds of janitors doormen porters & security guards are working every day while risking exposure to COVID-19. They deserve hazard pay PPE and job protection. I'll be fighting for their protection in the next stimulus bill. @32BJSEIU https://t.co/SDhFfWO9E4

Stephen Miller is using the coronavirus crisis as an excuse to push his xenophobic anti-immigration agenda.   Immigrants are essential -- I'll continue fighting these hostile policies throughout this crisis and beyond. https://t.co/DlbJOfqx5s

Our nurses are heroes on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic. Today on #NationalNursesDay we applaud the nurses on the frontlines of this pandemic and join them in demanding protective equipment and safe working conditions.

Immigrants like every person in America are struggling and they're in desperate need of relief.   I'm fighting to include those without legal status in the next federal coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/E8gYvyTqNG

Trump is exploiting the coronavirus crisis to further his xenophobic immigration agenda.   The US needs immigrants now and it will need immigrants for long after this crisis is over. https://t.co/6tAcUEqdxP

It's impossible for students to receive a quality education during this crisis without internet access at home.  We must include broadband funding in the next coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/dBWppHuX12
Migrants across the country are concerned about the risk of contracting coronavirus in detention centers. They have no space to social distance. They must be released. https://t.co/Pkgdyq7ymh

Coronavirus poses a serious threat not only to those living within jails but also those living in their surrounding communities. Thousands of lives are at risk -- we must act quickly. https://t.co/LQB5HCcUGa

The Trump Administration is punishing US citizens simply because they're married to an undocumented immigrant who pays taxes using an ITIN number.   This is nonsensical and cruel. We can't afford to leave ANYONE out of our coronavirus response. https://t.co/OjL8Pq6skL

Donald Trump is yet again using the coronavirus pandemic to push his own anti-immigrant agenda.   This kind of threat is unacceptable. I'll keep fighting to keep ALL people safe throughout this crisis. https://t.co/eEeIiIgivT
Prisons are not made to handle the rapidly spreading coronavirus.  This is not justice. This is a public health disaster. https://t.co/e92cofz11r
South Asian communities are being undercounted in NYC's #COVID19 data. We need to count our communities to properly care for them. https://t.co/H5FGaqKJmP

People of color are being hit disproportionately harder by the coronavirus than anyone else. In nursing homes they're even more vulnerable.  We must do more for our communities of color and continue to address these inequalities. https://t.co/JyhLWZMcEP

Puerto Rico is far behind where it should be in coronavirus testing making it impossible to know where it lies on the infection curve.  Puerto Ricans need to know the risk to their health. The dysfunction must end. https://t.co/MyVdgjZa6a
There are currently no FDA-approved products to prevent or treat #COVID19. Disinfectants are poison. This is dangerous and untrue. https://t.co/8xQXYVKRyn

Mitch McConnell doesn’t want to give more money to the states hit hardest by COVID-19 instead suggesting they go bankrupt.  That is outrageous. I'll continue fighting for New York and for the other epicenters where Americans are desperate for aid. https://t.co/RDuihYZErJ
More than 200 NYC workers have died from the coronavirus.   They must be protected. https://t.co/ouZwRjyWd9

Today is the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay! As we deal with the #COVID19 pandemic let's also remember that the climate crisis is a public health crisis -- one for which we need bold policy and action.  Our planet needs us. Let's take care of it.

Immigrants are not to blame for the #COVID19 crisis. This is a dangerous distraction from what our federal government should be focused on -- testing ensuring everyone has access to healthcare and supporting our frontline workers. https://t.co/GTz2uLcrge

While coronavirus cases in New York appear to be plateauing infections in NY prisons are rising rapidly.   Social distancing is impossible in prison. We must do more to protect the incarcerated. https://t.co/yreKhYnWJp
Communities of color are being hit harder by the coronavirus than anyone else. The Trump Administration's response must directly address that inequity.  https://t.co/uA5anXK6Qv

New York is overwhelmed. We need adequate aid to deal with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.  I'm calling for the next relief package to be allocated to states based on their share of the national infection rate. https://t.co/VvsjXIK9Km
Coronavirus is no joke -- I would know.   Please take this seriously and stay home. https://t.co/YXum2huxO6

Bellevue Hospital is caring for an overwhelming amount of COVID patients. There can be no compromises when it comes to someone's health. We need to make sure they have adequate supplies and protective gear. https://t.co/vIeH0n89bQ

DACA recipients are on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic as workers in healthcare education and food services. Across the nation nearly 650000 DACA recipients live raise children and pay taxes each year.  We need them here. https://t.co/9TZhpMXiFg

The coronavirus is killing black and Latino people in New York City at twice the rate that it's killing white people.  Our solution to this pandemic must take race into account. https://t.co/7h9iHFa4bk
Stay home check in on others volunteer or donate. Here's how to help your NYC neighbors during the coronavirus pandemic: https://t.co/5DuGU86UCT
Low-income immigrant communities in New York need focused attention and care to survive the coronavirus. They cannot be forgotten. https://t.co/s38lRUhPZe
Immigrants are at high risk of contracting COVID-19. I'm so grateful for those on the frontlines helping others through this crisis. https://t.co/7O8Mu3aKm7
